title: Aluminum Eases from 3-Year High
summary: Aluminum futures in the UK fell to $2,850 per tonne from the three-year high of $2,915 on November 3rd, tracking a broad pullback for base metals amid soft manufacturing PMIs in the US and China. Despite the pullback, lingering supply concerns maintained prices 12% higher year-to-date, with China reiterating its priority of preventing overcapacity in metal production.

title: Alcoa says high US aluminum prices offset Trump tariff costs
summary: Alcoa Corp. reported that US tariffs on Canadian aluminum cost it $69 million more than the prior quarter, but higher domestic prices for the metal helped offset the impact. The company noted that rising US prices reflect declining inventory and aluminum imports, with the US Midwest premium jumping 113% since early June.

title: Forget Rare Earths: Aluminum Is the Metal of the Moment
summary: Aluminum is trading at a three-year high near US$2,900 per metric ton, with investment fund net positioning on the London aluminum contract shifting dramatically to strongly bullish for the first time since early 2022. Supply constraints in China combined with recovering global demand are driving prices upward, with analysts forecasting potential supply deficits in 2026.

title: ELYSIS announces breakthrough with commercial-scale inert anode cell
summary: ELYSIS has activated its 450 kiloampere (kA) inert anode cell at Rio Tinto's smelter in Alma, Québec, marking a major step forward in large-scale aluminum production with a lower carbon footprint. The technology demonstrates the ability to produce aluminum with significantly reduced environmental impact.

title: Aluminium rod production cut wave hits: Nearly 800,000 tonnes of capacity undergoes concentrated maintenance shutdowns in November
summary: According to SMM statistics, nearly 800,000 tonnes of aluminum rod production capacity is undergoing concentrated maintenance shutdowns in November. This represents a significant reduction in production capacity during the month.

title: Global aluminium foil demand is set to hit 7.2 MT by 2028 — with the Americas playing a key role
summary: Global aluminum foil demand is projected to reach 7.2 million tonnes by 2028, up from 6.1 million tonnes in 2023. The Americas region is expected to play a significant role in driving this growth in the aluminum foil market.

title: Aluminum breakthrough brings Elysis technology closer to market
summary: Alcoa Corp. and Rio Tinto Plc’s joint venture Elysis has achieved a technological milestone at a Quebec smelter, demonstrating high-amperage aluminum production with no direct CO2 emissions. The breakthrough brings Elysis’s inert anode technology closer to commercialization, with plans for broader deployment by the end of the decade.

title: Aluminum plant. aluminum smelting bucket. Safe environmental high-tech processes. Modern smelter. Melting furnace.
summary: Ethiopia has signed an agreement with Rusal to build a new aluminum plant featuring modern, environmentally safe smelting technology. The project will utilize high-tech processes and advanced smelting equipment to ensure sustainability and efficiency.

title: Steel Rebounds to Highest in November
summary: Steel rebar futures in China rose to CNY 3,050 per tonne, the highest since early November, driven by Beijing's anti-involution policy reducing supply. Crude steel output in China fell 12% year-on-year in October, marking the lowest output since 2021 for that month, contributing to the price increase.

title: Global Iron and Steel Prices and News 16.11.2025
summary: In Turkey, billet prices increased in late October affecting domestic supplies and imports from Russia, though Russian companies face weak demand outside Turkey. Turkish steel producers have struggled to raise rebar prices despite rising costs of scrap and semi-finished products.

title: Major steel and raw material futures prices in China – November 14, 2025
summary: Chinese rebar futures traded at RMB 3,053/mt with minor weekly changes in steel and raw material prices globally. Turkish rebar prices showed slight increases, while other markets like European longs remained stable. The report highlights mixed price movements and regional variations in steel and raw material futures.

title: Steel Market Report 2025-2035: Impact Analysis of U.S. Trade Tariffs
summary: The global steel market is projected to surpass $1.79 trillion in 2025, driven by infrastructure investments worldwide. U.S. steel tariffs, recently increased to 50%, are reshaping the market by supporting domestic prices but creating cost pressures for manufacturers relying on imports. Countries like Mexico are negotiating exemptions to maintain exports to the U.S.

title: Steel prices in the third week of November 2025
summary: The global steel market showed mixed price movements in the third week of November 2025, with slight increases in some raw materials. This reflects ongoing volatility and regional differences in steel pricing trends.

title: Industrial price for electricity bypasses German steel industry – WVStahl
summary: The German steel industry faces challenges as industrial electricity prices rise, impacting production costs. Other news includes India approving a $5 billion steel-related investment and France reducing steel production by 18.1% year-on-year in June.

title: US prime steel scrap contracts market undergoing major reset amid falling prices
summary: The US steel scrap market is experiencing a major reset with mills and suppliers renegotiating contracts due to falling prices and shifting leverage. The ongoing US government shutdown is causing delays in federal projects, weakening demand and pressuring the steel manufacturing sector.

title: Steel Rebounds to Highest in November
summary: Steel rebar futures in China rose to CNY 3,050 per tonne, the highest since early November, driven by Beijing's anti-involution policy reducing supply. Crude steel output in China fell 12% year-on-year in October, marking the lowest monthly output since 2021, while steel exports dropped 12.5%, reflecting protectionist pressures from Southeast Asia and Latin America.

title: CISA mills' daily crude steel output up 6.0 percent in early November 2025, stocks also up
summary: The China Iron and Steel Association reported a 6.0% increase in average daily crude steel output of large and medium-sized steel enterprises in China during November 1-10, 2025, compared to late October. Finished steel inventories also rose by 5.9% to 15.49 million metric tons as of November 10.

title: Tata Steel Nederland to acquire Vattenfall power plants in IJmond region
summary: Tata Steel Nederland signed an agreement to acquire Vattenfall's power plants in the IJmond region, which are fueled by residual gases from steel production. This acquisition aims to facilitate Tata Steel's transition to low carbon, green steel production by gaining more control over the energy supply chain.

title: Weekly Raw Steel Production Data
summary: In the week ending November 8, 2025, U.S. domestic raw steel production was 1,758,000 net tons with a capacity utilization rate of 76.7%. Year-to-date production through October 11, 2025, was up 2.5% compared to the previous year, indicating a moderate increase in steel production capacity utilization.

title: Steel news and insights about steel market - steel prices - GMK Center
summary: Recent steel market updates include a 5.4% year-on-year increase in steel production in Spain for the first half of 2025, a 7.6% month-on-month reduction in U.S. rolled steel imports in June, and a 5.8% year-on-year decline in global steel production in June. Additionally, ArcelorMittal temporarily shut down a blast furnace in Poland due to import pressures.

title: The Global Steel Industry 2025: At a Pivotal Crossroads
summary: The steel industry is undergoing major changes with innovations in AI, green steel, hydrogen use, automation, and sustainability. Green steel production is rising due to demand for low-carbon materials, with hydrogen and electric arc furnaces playing key roles in decarbonizing steelmaking processes.

title: Scaling Near Zero Emissions Iron and Steel
summary: RMI is accelerating the transition of steel producers to low-emissions facilities by improving emissions data transparency and promoting hydrogen-based technologies. The steel sector, responsible for about 11% of global greenhouse gas emissions, must modernize through recycling, hydrogen direct reduction, and decarbonization roadmaps to align with climate goals.

title: Climate change and the production of iron and steel - 2025
summary: The steel industry supports the Paris Agreement and is committed to a low-carbon future by improving process efficiency, maximizing scrap use, and deploying innovative low-carbon technologies. Steel’s recyclability and role in climate-resilient infrastructure make it central to the circular economy and climate adaptation.

title: Decarbonizing steel is as tough as steel
summary: A study by MIT and partners shows advanced steelmaking technologies like electric arc furnaces combined with hydrogen or natural gas with carbon capture could substantially reduce steel sector emissions by 2050. The study emphasizes combining recycling, fuel switching, and technology cost reductions to achieve deep decarbonization aligned with the 1.5°C climate goal.

title: GSCC Certifies First Low Emission Hot-Rolled Steel Products
summary: The Global Steel Climate Council certified the first low-emission hot-rolled steel products from ASA and SDI, establishing a new benchmark for climate-aligned steel. The GSCC also certified Nucor, North America's largest steel producer, for its ambitious emissions reduction targets, advancing low-carbon steel technologies globally.

title: Copper prices fall as trade tensions and the US government shutdown weigh
summary: Copper prices dropped 0.7% to $10,566 per metric tonne on the London Metal Exchange amid concerns about manufacturing demand, especially in China, and the ongoing US government shutdown. Despite recent supply disruptions pushing prices to a 16-month high, analysts expect a market surplus for now and caution that Chinese buyers may avoid the market if prices exceed $11,000.

title: Copper price falls on Fed uncertainty, Codelco supply relief
summary: Copper prices declined as much as 2.4% amid uncertainty over US monetary policy and easing concerns about global supply due to expected output increases from Chile's Codelco mine. The dollar's strength and a less dynamic demand outlook, despite recent supply disruptions, contributed to the price drop.

title: Copper - Price - Chart - Historical Data - News - Trading Economics
summary: Copper prices fell slightly to $5.04 per pound on November 14, 2025, down 0.21% from the previous day, but remain up 24.43% year-over-year. The market remains cautious due to the recent US government shutdown and weak trade data from China, with speculation that China may impose stricter controls on copper smelting projects to curb overcapacity.

title: Copper Prices Fall 2.4% | Weekly Scrap Metal Market Recap
summary: Copper prices fell 2.45% in the week ending November 6, 2025, after a two-week rally, influenced by a strong US dollar and plateauing construction activity. The decline was broad-based across various copper scrap categories, reflecting mixed demand signals.

title: Why Copper Markets Face an Unprecedented Supply Squeeze
summary: Copper prices have reached $5 per pound amid major supply disruptions removing over 500,000 tonnes from 2025 production. Industry leaders and Goldman Sachs forecast prices could reach $12,000 per tonne by the end of 2025 due to critical incidents at major mines and steady demand growth requiring new mine development annually.

title: Lundin Mining Reports Third Quarter 2025 Results and Increases Full-Year Copper Production Guidance
summary: Lundin Mining updated its full-year copper production guidance, increasing the midpoint by 11,500 tonnes to a range of 319,000 to 337,000 tonnes due to strong operational performance, especially at the Caserones mine. The company also lowered its consolidated copper cash cost guidance to $1.85 to $2.00 per pound, benefiting from improved grades and operational efficiencies.

title: Copper Price News Today Sep 11-16 2025: Updates
summary: Copper prices surged 3.2% during this period, influenced by ongoing supply chain disruptions in South America, particularly Chile and Peru, which account for nearly 40% of global copper output. Labor strikes, stricter environmental regulations, and production disruptions have reduced mine output, raising concerns about global supply stability.

title: Border States Commodity Update — November 2025
summary: Copper prices reached new highs on the London Metal Exchange, driven by a US-China trade deal, but supply disruptions at key mines are intensifying, signaling a potential shortage in 2026 despite a current surplus. The International Copper Study Group expects production to drop by 150,000 metric tons in 2026, reversing earlier surplus forecasts.

title: DPM Metals Reports Record Third Quarter 2025 Financial Results
summary: DPM Metals reported a 6% increase in copper production in Q3 2025 compared to 2024, driven by higher ore volumes and grades despite lower recoveries. However, copper production for the first nine months of 2025 was 8% lower than the previous year due to lower grades and recoveries, consistent with the mine plan.

title: Copper price falls on Fed uncertainty, Codelco supply relief
summary: Copper prices declined amid uncertainty over US monetary policy and eased concerns about global supply due to Codelco's expected output increase this year and next. Despite significant supply disruptions, analysts do not expect a market deficit because demand remains subdued and trade tensions between the US and China are easing.

title: AI Boom Pushes Copper Toward a Supply Crunch, BNEF Warns
summary: A BloombergNEF report highlights that the rapid growth of AI data centers is increasing copper demand, potentially causing a supply crunch. The report forecasts demand could rise by 400,000 tonnes annually, with prices possibly reaching $13,500 per tonne by 2028, adding pressure from energy transition projects and fragile mine supply.

title: Extraction 2025: Cutting-edge Developments in Copper Mining, Production, and Fabrication
summary: The Extraction 2025 conference, starting today in Phoenix, Arizona, brings together global leaders to discuss the latest innovations in copper mining, production, and sustainability. The event features sessions on emerging technologies and multidisciplinary approaches to resource extraction and materials innovation.

title: [SMM Nickel Midday Review] Nickel prices fell sharply on November 14
summary: Nickel prices on the SHFE fell sharply, closing at 117,530 yuan/mt, down 1.1% amid market caution triggered by concerns over a hawkish US Federal Reserve and lack of key economic data. Spot nickel prices also declined, with premiums slightly rising despite the overall weak market sentiment. Prices are expected to remain weak in the near term due to uncertainty and divergent Fed views.

title: Nickel fell to 14,880 USD/T on November 14, 2025
summary: Nickel prices decreased to $14,880 per tonne, down 0.53% from the previous day, continuing a downward trend over the past month and year due to oversupply and muted demand. The price is near a recent low of $15,078, reflecting ongoing market weakness despite Indonesia's large output.

title: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in November period I
summary: The Indonesia Nickel Miners Association set benchmark prices for nickel ore for early November 2025, with prices slightly down by about 0.44% compared to late October. Prices vary by nickel content grade, reflecting a modest decline amid ongoing supply pressures.

title: Nickel Price Collapse Forces Market Repricing as Oversupply & Weak Demand Challenge Producers
summary: Nickel prices have collapsed to around $15,000 per tonne, down 10% year-over-year, driven by oversupply with a forecasted 198,000t surplus in 2025 and high inventories. Structural market adjustments are underway, including supply chain realignments due to tariffs and geopolitical factors. Despite current weakness, long-term demand growth remains supported by electric vehicle and grid storage needs.

title: Nickel price hits 4-year low as gloom offsets potential Indonesia cuts
summary: Nickel prices dropped to a four-year low around $15,235 per tonne due to a weak outlook from the Federal Reserve and oversupply concerns, despite potential mining cuts in Indonesia. The price decline reflects slower electric vehicle sales and abundant supply, with nickel trending about 8% lower in 2025.

title: Shanghai Nickel Prices Stuck in Volatile Range, Awaiting Fundamental Supply-Demand Realignment
summary: Shanghai nickel prices have fluctuated within a narrow range due to persistent oversupply and high inventories, with warehouse receipts and LME stocks at four-year highs. Market views are mixed, balancing expectations of Fed rate cuts and new energy policies against supply surplus and trade uncertainties. A fundamental restructuring of supply and demand is needed for a price breakthrough.

title: Nickel Prices Plunge in 2025: Can Demand Revive the Market by 2030?
summary: Nickel prices fell to lows not seen since 2020, driven by a strong US dollar, oversupply, and slower demand growth. Analysts predict prices around $15,700 per tonne, insufficient to attract new investments currently. However, demand from electric vehicles and environmental regulations is expected to drive prices higher by 2030 as supply tightens.

title: Nickel Prices: Demand Woes Plague Stainless Market
summary: Nickel prices and the stainless steel market have softened due to demand challenges emerging from Q3 2025. Indian primary nickel prices slipped slightly, and various surcharges and related metal prices showed modest declines or slow growth, reflecting broader market softness.

title: Nornickel maintains 2025 nickel production forecast
summary: Russia's Nornickel maintained its nickel production outlook for 2025 at 196,000-204,000 metric tons, with Q3 production rising 18% to 54,000 metric tons. The company attributed production declines in the first nine months to the need to replace Western mining equipment as part of its import substitution program.

title: Indonesia releases benchmark prices for nickel ore in November period I
summary: The Indonesia Nickel Miners Association announced benchmark prices for nickel ore for the first half of November 2025, with the reference price set at $15,075.33/wmt, dropping 0.44% from October's second period. Prices across all nickel grades declined slightly from the previous month.

title: Energy Minister Tim Hodgson highlights Canada Nickel's Crawford mine
summary: Canada's Energy Minister announced that Canada Nickel's Crawford mine was fast-tracked for federal approval as one of seven new initiatives. The project, located 42 miles north of Timmins, Ontario, has the potential to become one of the top 10 nickel producers globally with nearly 90% lower carbon emissions and is projected to generate over $70 billion in GDP.

title: Lifezone Metals Raises $15 Million to Advance Kabanga Nickel Project in Tanzania
summary: Lifezone Metals launched a $15 million direct share offering to advance its Kabanga nickel project in Tanzania, following a $60 million loan from Taurus Mining Finance. The company aims to prepare for a final investment decision by mid-2026, with the revised feasibility study projecting 902,000 tons of nickel over 18 years.

title: Indonesia limits new nickel permits to add value to production
summary: Indonesia stopped approving applications for nickel plants making certain intermediate products without further processing plans, including nickel pig iron, matte, and mixed hydroxide precipitate. This regulatory move aims to push the world's largest nickel producer further up the value chain and address persistent oversupply issues.

title: Turning CO2 Into Clean Fuel Faster and Cheaper
summary: A new copper-magnesium-iron catalyst transforms CO2 into CO at low temperatures with record-breaking efficiency and stability. The discovery paves the way for affordable, scalable production of carbon-neutral synthetic fuels.

title: A Simple Metal Could Solve the World's Plastic Recycling Problem
summary: Scientists at Northwestern University have developed a groundbreaking nickel-based catalyst that could transform the way the world recycles plastic. The catalyst selectively breaks down stubborn polyolefin plastics without requiring tedious sorting.

title: Ottawa backs three key mining projects
summary: The Department of Defense has committed up to $10 million in milestone-based funding to advance engineering, drilling, and alloy qualification work at NioCorp Developments Ltd.'s Elk Creek critical minerals project in southeastern Nebraska, supporting development of a domestic scandium supply chain.

title: Cogne Acciai Speciali Receives ResponsibleSteel Certification
summary: Cogne Acciai Speciali S.p.A. has achieved initial core site certification from ResponsibleSteel, an independent certification body. This certification recognizes the company's commitment to responsible steel production practices and sustainable operations.
query: Cogne Acciai Speciali news aluminum steel italy

title: Italy's Tenaris posts 2% rise in quarterly net sales
summary: Tenaris, the Italian steel pipe maker, reported a 2% increase in net sales for the third quarter of 2025. The rise was driven by higher sales volumes, particularly in unwelded and welded steel pipes used mainly in drilling activities across global markets.

title: Advancing power generation: Tenaris in dialogue with Macchi at Hydrogen Expo 2025
summary: At the Hydrogen Expo 2025 in Piacenza, Italy, Tenaris showcased its steel solutions designed for power generation with a focus on performance and sustainability. The company highlighted its long-term collaboration with Macchi, emphasizing customized high-performance tubular products and investments in manufacturing capabilities to support advanced power generation technologies.

title: Tenaris completes $85 million USD exhaust system upgrade to boost sustainability
summary: Tenaris completed a major $85 million upgrade to the fume exhaust system at its steel mill in Koppel, Pennsylvania, enhancing dust and particulate capture and reducing carbon monoxide emissions. This investment is part of a broader $140 million commitment to modernize the plant and improve environmental performance, supporting local jobs and sustainability goals.

title: Tenaris Announces Second Tranche of USD 600 Million Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris initiated the second tranche of its USD 1.2 billion share buyback program, agreeing to purchase up to USD 600 million of its shares through a financial institution starting November 3, 2025. The buyback aims to reduce outstanding shares and is part of the company's capital management strategy amid fluctuating oil and gas market conditions.

title: Tenaris to Commence a USD 600 million Second Tranche of its USD 1.2 Billion Share Buyback Program
summary: Tenaris announced the commencement of the second tranche of its USD 1.2 billion share buyback program, with purchases up to USD 600 million to be executed by a financial institution. The program is authorized by shareholders and aims to cancel repurchased shares, reflecting the company's ongoing financial strategy.

title: Italian expertise fuels Prysmian innovation
summary: Prysmian is investing heavily in R&D in Italy, with €216 million invested between 2021 and 2024 and plans for an additional €270 million by 2028. The Milan R&D center is central to Prysmian’s innovation strategy, focusing on energy transition and digital transformation, supported by Italian institutions and funding programs such as the Green New Deal for submarine energy cables.

title: Prysmian Awarded The Italy-Tunisia Interconnection
summary: Prysmian won the tender for the submarine power interconnection project between Italy and Tunisia, known as the Elmed Project, valued at around €460 million. The project will enhance energy security between Europe and Africa, with the cable running between Sicily and Tunisia at depths up to 800 meters, utilizing Prysmian's specialized installation vessel.

title: Copper Wire Market Size to Cross USD 284.70 Billion by 2034
summary: Following the U.S. government's 50% tariff on imported copper, Prysmian's vertically integrated operations, including a copper rod mill in Texas and sourcing from an Arizona mine, position it to benefit by improving margins in its U.S. low-voltage business. Prysmian remains a key player in the global copper wire market, supplying copper cables for power and communication infrastructure.

title: Atkore, Prysmian Quarterly Results - Impact of Commodity Pricing
summary: Prysmian reported solid first half 2025 revenues of €9,654 million with 4.0% organic growth, partly driven by the inclusion of Encore Wire. However, uncertainty over copper tariffs has caused Prysmian to pause further U.S. expansion plans despite its vertical integration mitigating some tariff impacts.
